moves.1. e4: Most masters open with this move in simuls. It usually leads to a quicker win.
moves.1... e6: Electing to play a French defense, hoping to draw out his resistance.
moves.6. Nxc3: The logical response, to avoid doubled Pawns and win back Black's advanced pawn.
moves.6... Nc6: Black counters with a threat to Dake's QP.
moves.7... Nxd4: Black has a brilliant counter in mind, which Dake overlooks.
moves.8. Qxg7: Following through with his plan. However, QxP(K4) was a *much* better alternative.
moves.8... Nxc2+: With mate to follow at once.
moves.9... Qd3#: Bravo! Score one for the amateur!

opening: French (C15), Winawer, Alekhine gambit, Kan variation
